story:
What is the Level Power Mül?

Let the electric Level Power Mül power your bike.  Have you ever found yourself frustrated, overloaded or unable to transport all your stuff on a bike?  Wished the hill was a little easier?  Wanting a little boost?  While standard ebikes and bike trailers are an option, they all have limitations for everyday use.  Trailers are bulky and heavy. Ebikes limit your riding style selection and make you buy an expensive separate bike. This is where the Level Power Mül electric assist steps in, making biking a viable everyday transportation option:

 

-3rd wheel design transfers the cart load to the driving wheel, effectively removing trailer load impact on bike handling and effort.

                                                                                            

-Quick release bike connection and conversion into an electric cart allows use in the grocery store, walking paths, and other areas of foot traffic.

-Narrow design allows it to fit through a standard door, and wheel protection rails keep it from hanging and snagging on objects.

-And best of all, the electric drive is like having someone push you the whole way!

Why a Level Power Mül?

-The design adds electric power to your existing bike with no modification.   Cruiser. Mountain. Road.  Pick the ride YOU like, as it will fit all bikes.

-Leave the car at home.  With a 100lb carrying capacity, the Power Mül can easily haul a weeks worth of groceries, a days worth of tools, a cooler to the beach, or your best furry friend.  With the assist of the Power Mül, your riding is faster and effortless, and off bike powered usage opens even more possibilities to make your life easier.

                                                    

-Simple and self contained.  The open design allows unlimited variations, and the on board compartment holds the battery, controller and charger.  You can even stash an extension cord if desired.

-Take a load off your back.  Ditch the backpack/shoulder bag and ride cooler, safer and more comfortably. 

-Convenience. The Power Mül is designed for quick connect/disconnect to your bike, and sized to fit through standard entry doors.  Take the cart from bike to store to your kitchen easily.

-Level out the hills.  Live in a hilly location?  The Power Mül assist hauls the load up for you.  The Power Mül will even push you along if desired, giving you the choice of how much you want to pedal.  Use the throttle for flat ground speeds of up to 20mph.

-Portable and easy to install.  With an additional hitch kit, the same Power Mül can easily move from bike to bike.  The coupling portion that stays with the bike is minimal and will not impede riding in any way, and requires no bike modifications.  Initial installation consists of simply removing the seat and installing the hitch coupling, tightening the control to the handlebar, and routing and securing the wire from the handlebar control to the coupling.

 

Electrify your cycling!

With the Level Power Mül you are helping keep one more car off the streets, while enabling you to save both time and money.  By removing the burden of bike loads, the Power Mül allows you to do more shopping, hauling, and carrying while also doubling as a general purpose off the bike utility cart. The electric assist feature of the Power Mül also enables more comfortable riding by opening up options in rider clothing. Since most errands don't really need a large car to complete, by using the Power Mül instead you help reduce congestion and pollution for everyone.

We have prototyped and tested the core unit, with an eye toward a modular concept.   While we feel we have a pretty good design, the possible features and configurations are endless. Support our campaign and help mold and create the best, most usable cycle accessory ever.

Tech Specs

  • Empty weight including battery and charger : 45 lbs (21.5 kg)
  • Cargo area: 18 in x 28 in (46 cm x 71 cm)
  • Minimum pass through dimension (door width): 29 in (75 cm)
  • Integrated drive motor: 250W standard.
  • Battery: Li-Ion, 36V 10Ah standard.
  • Cart mounted control: On/Off, three power levels, walk mode, battery charge status.
  • Bike mounted control: Thumb throttle, e-stop, battery charge status.

Power Mül=easier handling=more bikes=less cars=less congestion=less pollution

  1. Who are we?

We are one e-bike trading & manufacture company, since 2014, based in China Mainland and HongKong. Know more about us you can go to www.elecycles.com or www.ele-cycle.com.

  1. What are we doing?

We are working with Chongqing Qiulong Technology Co., Ltd, who is the designer and production of Sur-Ron to do the crowdfunding. In this way, we hope people wherever you are can have one Sur-Ron in a good price and a good after sale service.

  1. Sales area

As we have exclusive dealers in some countries like Germany, Austria, Belgium, France, Benelux and Italy,  customers in these countries we suggest to go to the dealers to buy it. For all the other countries in European, feel free to order it.

to make sure you are truly want it as we do not accept the return because you just do not like it after you get it.

Any questions, please feel free to cotnact us via email

support@elecycles.com. The designers of Sur-Ron will help you to solve the issues.

 

C.Warranty time 12 months.

 

The product is warranted for one year against defective quality.

Warranty does not apply to damages arising from artificial factors and external forces.

 

During the warranty time, we promise to provide free spare parts to you for free.

 

The Sur-Ron has the installation instruction inside the package which will help you but if you still meet some problems when you install it,  just feel free to contact us we will take a video for you. Or you can check Sur-ron unboxing videos on youtube.

story:
Mads Flying Cars

                                    See My Website @:  madsflyingcars.com (Click on it)

      Hello, my name is John.  I graduated from high school 17th in my class.  I earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Physical Education with a Minor in Biology, and then I went on to received a Medical Degree and a residency in Family Practice.  I worked in the Emergency Room thereafter for 20 years.  Prior to college, I joined the Air National Guard and worked on Voodoo's and F-4s for 6 years as a hydraulic specialist.  This is where I was educated in aircraft mechanics.  See my website:  madsflyingcars.com

      I have wanted to fly ever since I was a child living in Phoenix.  My dad had a farm that was in the final flight path of Sky Harbor Airport.  There were so many planes that flew over our farm, day and night, from 300 to 500 feet above us and I especially feel in love with the crop dusters that sprayed my dads fields.  I was hooked.   See my website:  madsflyingcars.com

      When I saw the first star wars movies in the mid 70s and saw Luke's land speeder, I realized that I needed to build something that would carry me where I wanted to go beyond an ATV, car or just a plane.  I started to think of many different designs and finally in 2018 I came up with the final and definitive model.  This is the one you see in my information.  It took approximately 6 months to build the model to scale.  After all that I have contemplated in building this vehicle and all time the research I have put into it, it will all come to pass with time and money.  See my website:  madsflyingcars.com

       I will need approximately $750,000.00 to complete this project.  For this project to be completed right, with the right amount of custom engines, avionics, 7075 aircraft grade aluminum and composite materials for the fuselage and rotors and propellers.  All of this will take a large amount of money.  In building this flying car, I will be building two of these machines.  A number 1 and a number 2.  They will be exactly the same and built at the same time.  The second car will be raffled off at the end of the build to all that have contributed to my endeavor if I receive the amount that is requested for the build.  If I don't get the full amount, I will have to adjust the build with different materials for the one primary car.  See my website:  madsflyingcars.com

      I have built and fixed a lot of things in my life:  I have built a house, I have customized 7 cars, and two motorcycles, I have fixed and repaired: 101 voodoo aircraft, F-4 aircraft, f-104s, A-4s and several private aircraft.  See my website:  madsflyingcars.com

      This build should take approximately 2 years.  The body or fuselage I have to build but it is very simple compared to a lot of aircraft or helicopters.  All of the parts needed to build this flying car are already made and just need to be purchased and installed for both the aircraft and automobile sections.  AlI aircraft associated parts are very expensive.  I have already purchased one engine for the main rotors that runs approximately $35,000.00.  I have gone over this build in my mind thousands of time, but I am sure there will be problems I have to over come, which I will.  I know how to work with laths and mills, I know how to weld both tig and mig.  If I thought I couldn't finish this build I would not pursue it.  I know my limits.    See my website:  madsflyingcars.com

       A vehicle such as the one you see in this campaign can and will be used by many.  It will have uses in the private sector, the military, law enforcement, medical and firefighting as well as forestry. The flying cars that are available today need a runway to take off and land on.  Basically an airport.  This flying car does not need this.  It acts like a helicopter, but much easier to build and fly secondary to contra rotating rotors and propellers.  I have 3 patents that will cover all the important aspects of this machine to fly.  Everything that will go into this flying car is to simplify it.  That means in the future more people will be able to fly one without extensive licenses and training as current pilots now have to.  See my website:  madsflyingcars.com 

       I will keep everybody updated with photos on my website on a monthly basis if this succeeds.  For those that believe in this project, please tell your friends, any and all, so this project can proceed and change the world for all of us.           Thank You.   John.

******   A PERK as noted in this Campaign:  Equals: for every $33.00 you donate you will get one chance of winning the second flying car in a raffle valued at approximately $3,000,000.00.  EXAMPLE:  If you donate $100,00 you have 3 chances in the raffle at the end of the build.  If you donate $1,000.00 you will have 30 chances in winning and etc.  There will be only one flying car raffled off.

      * If this campaign succeeds, I will have all contributor's names printed on the sides of my aircraft for all to see.  God Bless.

 

 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
FEATURED IN

WHAT IS WOOLF® DRIVE

After the extraordinary success of WOOLF®, the world's first wearable device for driving dedicated to bikers, we are ready to introduce WOOLF® Drive, the new driving assistant designed for car drivers.

WOOLF® Drive is an innovative accessory that perfectly fits inside your car, positioned directly on the steering wheel. It informs you about the presence of speed cameras and other sensitive points thanks to discreet vibration alerts, avoiding to distract you while driving with annoying sound or visual alarms that can reveal dangerous. WOOLF® Drive will signal you when to slow down near fixed and mobile speed cams, notifying you of new locations but remembering also the old ones on well-known routes, which you can often forget about.

HOW IT WORKS

WOOLF® Drive uses the same technology employed by the motorcycle version, classified Accessory of the year 2016 according to the readers of Motociclismo (second classified).
Alerts are performed through an accurate localization system and thanks to the Bluetooth® connection with your device.

 

Once you paired WOOLF® Drive with the dedicated App through a simple wizard you will no longer have to worry about downloading daily updates, maps or routes; WOOLF® Drive will do it for you. Daily updates of the speedcam database will automatically run directly from your phone. The automatic updating of App services will be free of charge anytime for all campaign supporters.

The application developed by the team requires an active connection only during the upgrade phase, while in mobility it does not require constant data connection, but only active GPS positioning and Bluetooth®, ensuring in this way the operation in non-covered areas, minimizing data traffic consumption and optimizing your smartphone battery performance.

 

VERSIONS

WOOLF® Drive is available in 5 different versions designed to perfectly fit inside your car, harmoniously adapting to your style. The catalog includes 3 Leather versions and 2 versions in Premium Synthetic Leather. WOOLF® Drive guarantees a design aimed to fully match with the interior of different cars models.

 

APP

WOOLF® Drive guarantees you the maximum ease of use. All you have to do is pair it through bluetooth with its dedicated app and place it on the steering wheel of your car.

Get in the car, turn on the Bluetooth® signal and GPS, open the App and enjoy a pleasant ride. WOOLF® Drive will work in background on your phone. The application allows you to monitor sensitive points such as speed cameras and traffic lights with cameras and receives updates when new points of interest are installed in the streets. The integrated mapping service in the device is the same as the one used by the most famous satellite navigators and by the major car manufacturers.

WOOLF’s database covers 51 countries by detecting more than 100,000 speed cameras, and these numbers makes it the largest existing database.

COMPONENTS

The WOOLF® Drive electronic card has been designed to ensure minimal encumbrance and hard-wearing over time. WOOLF® Drive has added to the best components available in the current industry a variety of treatments and solutions against sweat, humidity and high temperatures even during the summer. 
The rechargeable lithium ion battery installed on WOOLF® Drive has a capacity of 120mAh, and guarantees the operation of WOOLF® Drive for more than one month. The accelerometer allows WOOLF® Drive to turn off during inactivity, and to easily restart as soon as you get in the car. Thanks to the accelerometer, WOOLF® Drive recognizes your gestures and allows you to send alerts to other users.

 

MAIN FEATURES

  • Accurate and discreet reporting: WOOLF® Drive guarantees you a prompt signalization close to the selected points of interest;
  • Ease of use: after the first matching phase you will no longer have to worry. Just get in the car, open the app and enjoy the pleasure of driving;
  • You will not need to download maps neither to set navigation routes;
  • Reminder of known speed cams: Although you may be aware of the position of speed cams in well-known areas, it may happen to be distracted and forget them, incurring in fines and sanctions. WOOLF® Drive will help you prevent this possibility. 
  • Validated Design: WOOLF® Drive has been designed after collecting the reviews of customers who have already used the bike version;
  • 100% legal: WOOLF® Drive is a fully legal accessory, it is not a speed camera device because of its features and therefore it does not violate the Road Traffic Rules. 

BUDGET ALLOCATION

ROADMAP

At Thales Motors our team believes that transportation is fundamental to individuals of modern society. It provides accessibility where there are barriers. It provides choice where there is scarcity. Don't be confined.

With this belief in mind we see effective and sustainable transportation as the future. Electric drive trains provide superior specifications to their counter-parts and require little maintenance. Improving battery technology allows for affordable and energy dense power. With our belief and mission for a brighter future, The Arche was born.

 

❖ THE FOUNDER ❖

Thales Motors was founded by James Best. A business and design student from Ottawa, Canada. After two years of conceptualizing this company he finally decided to commit to it's construction. He has been a bike enthusiast all his life and believes electric power will have to inevitably dominate the transportation industry. 

 

❖ IT'S FAST ❖

 

❖ IT'S LIGHT ❖

 

 

❖ IT'S BEAUTIFUL ❖

 

 

❖ THE FEATURES ❖

50km range - 36v battery - USB port

Our batteries use leading Samsung lithium-ion battery technology and is built to last. Arche has a range of 50km and 6 adjustable levels of pedal assist. Just keep exploring!

Shimano 7-speed gear system

Arche comes with a 7-speed Shimano gear system to be optimally efficient on any surface. 

ZSTAR disk brakes

Disk brakes provide incredible braking capability, which is essential for a high-powered ebike. Never worry about your ability to stop in time. 

Powerful 350w rear hub-motor

Arche's 350w rear hub motor allows you to ride effortlessly at 32km/h. It also comes with a FREE one-year warranty.

Hidden battery built into the frame

Our battery is beautifully integrated into Arche's aluminium road frame. Resulting in the shocked look you receive when explaining to family and friends that this is an electric bike. 

KBY-DISP LCD Display

Arche comes with an LCD screen displaying battery level, speedometer, odometer and your current pedal-assist level. The screen is high contrast and even visible in direct sunlight.

Thickslick 700x25c tires

This puncture resistant, thick rubber, extreme grip and comfortable tire provides the Arche with improved braking distance and durability.

Weight of 14.5 Kilograms

Arche is as light as possible. Boasting a net weight of just 14.5 kilograms. 

 

 

❖ REPLACEABLE BATTERY ❖

Our built-in hidden frame battery has been extensively tested for safety and reliability. We are so confident that it comes with a 1.5 year warranty and if there is any problem with it we will send you another one for FREE. 

 

 ❖ SIMPLE CHARGING ❖

Charging is quick and easy. Simply open the charging port cover and plug the Arche CS in! Like the battery, the charger comes with a 1 year warranty and if there is any problem with it we will send you another one for FREE. 

 

❖ MINIMAL WIRING ❖

The Arche CS ebike is designed to be minimal. Wires or anything that hinders the sleek look has been hidden or removed. 

 

❖ RAIN? NO PROBLEM ❖

A common question we receive about the Arche CS is "can I ride it when it's raining outside?" Of course! The Arche CS is designed to last.

 

❖ 2 EASY STEPS ❖

Turning on the Arche CS is as easy as it gets. Turn the power button under the charging port cover ON, next turn the LCD display ON. That's it, the Arche CS is powered on and ready to get you where you need to be.

 

 

❖ COST-EFFECTIVE ❖

⧏ No registration ⧐ 

⧏ No hidden fees ⧐

⧏ No insurance ⧐

⧏ No gasoline ⧐

 

 

❖ CREATOR SERIES PACKAGE ❖

This package comes with selected tools that ensure your Arche continues to run efficiently into the future. At about the size of a water bottle, the CS package allows for quick on the go maintenance and repair. 

$100 value for FREE

⧏ 10-piece multi-tool ⧐ 

⧏ Standard bike wrench ⧐

⧏ Compact tire pump ⧐

⧏ Bike tire pliers ⧐

⧏ Tire patch kit ⧐

 

 

❖ WARRANTIES ❖

 

❖ IN THE PRESS ❖

 

 

❖ WHY ARCHE? ❖

By buying one of the Arche Creator Series ebikes here on INDIEGOGO you are fuelling the future ambitions of our company. Thales Motors was founded with a purpose and a PLAN. We plan to use this revenue to not only develop new ebike models for the market, but to begin prototyping an electric motorcycle. 

 

 

❖ THE TIMELINE ❖  

 

❖ MANUFACTURING CAPABILITY ❖

Supply chain management and manufacturing is an essential part of any business. Ours is streamlined for you, the owner. We will never go through dealership or retailer, we sell directly to you. We work with qualified and vetted suppliers for parts required to build the Arche and have a output capacity of 1000 bikes per month.

 

 

❖ Sizing and Colour ❖

Due to having a small team and a requirement to build an affordable yet elegant ebike we had to streamline options associated with Arche. Currently Arche will be offered in two sizes and one colour.

Beautiful Matte Black

In 1909, shortly after beginning production of the Model T Henry Ford was asked about potential paint colour options for the vehicle. To which he replied "You can have any colour as long as it's black."  Unfortunately, until our team is larger and relevant logistics are understood, we will only offer the Arche CS in beautiful matte black.

 

Large & Medium Seat Tubes

Large or 55cm is ideal for riders ranging in height from

5'10" to 6'3"

Medium or 52cm is ideal for riders ranging in height from 

5'5" to 5'10"

 

 

❖ Summary ❖

"At Thales Motors we have a mission and we need you to help execute it. Arche CS is a symbol of that mission and our underlying goals for this company. Every ebike sold, t-shirt worn and friend informed drives Thales Motors forward to an exciting future. The "why" built in to our team is that we believe that transportation is fundamental to individuals of modern society. We see inaccessibility to effective and sustainable transportation as a complete failure by the market and we aim to fix this, forever."

James Best, Business & Design, Founder of Thales Motors

 

 

❖ In Depth Specifications ❖

1. Frame: ,700C, Aluminum 
2. Fork: Aluminum
3. Rim: 700C*32H, Aluminum 
4. Tire: THICKSLICK 700Cx25C 
5. Crankset: 44T, Disc 
6. Brake & Lever: Front D-brake, Rear D-brake 
7. Rear Motor: AIKEMA 350W, 3/8*32H*14G 
8. Gear system: Shimano 7-speed
9. Hidden Battery: SAMSUNG 36V, 5.2AH 
10. Charge Time: 3.5 Hours 
11. Max Load: 120KG 
12. Max Range: 50KM 
13. Max Speed: 32KM/H 
14. Net Weight: 14.5KG

 

 

❖ Gallery ❖

story:
I am the administrator of a Facebook group ( www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) created in February of this year to collect all the owners of the Yamaha 600 TTR in the world who have encountered the same problem, rather handicapping, relating to the lack of availability of the rear fender on the market in relation to the exit of production, years ago and the lack of interest of the manufacturer (ed Yamaha) to proceed with a further limited production to meet this need.

I personally find it important to fix this problem definitively, as the lack of availability of a rear mudguard, a component that often breaks or deteriorates in relation to use, not only constitutes for any rallie or enduro motorcyclist a strong limitation to the use of the bike, but, especially for a vintage motorbike which in order to be registered in the register of vintage motorcycles must only mount original parts, becomes a very evident problem.

All of you, owners of a Yamaha 600TTR, now finally have the opportunity to get this much coveted component and to be able to put even some more in addition, as a spare for the future.

As all of you already had information weeks ago through the Facebook group "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", we have already selected the Italian manufacturer https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ and we are ready to go.

It will take approximately 60 working days, after this fundraising campaign is completed to get the finished product ready for shipment.

In order to be able to start production we have identified the minimum amount to reach equal to Euro 45,000 which corresponds to approximately 530 mudguards for a cost of approximately Euro 85 each.

In short, the 45,000 euros will be allocated for around 25,000 euros to mold production, around 15,000 euros to production, packaging and logistics and around 5,000 euros to fundraising costs.

If we do not reach the target amount, we will have two choices, either, or all the payments will be returned, or, against adhesion of the subscribers who will have already formalized their payments, the residual amount to reach the target amount it will be shared on the quantity of rear fenders already subscribed, to allow the start of production.

I come personally from the management of groups of companies also operating in the sector of plastic and similar components for the first installation of the car sector, consequently I am ready to face any problems of the path, but, I need all of you to let me help all of you in this, now multi-year problem, of lack of this component.

As already anticipated in recent months in the FB group the production of the mudguard will take place in POLYPROPYLENE COPOLYMER resistant to frost and UV with the affixing of a fabric with glass fiber of the size of 200x150mm under the right side in order to avoid burns of the plastic through the muffler.

ITALIAN language:

Sono l'amministratore di un gruppo Facebook (www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) nato per caso nel febbraio di quest'anno per raccogliere tutti i possessori della Yamaha 600 TTR nel mondo che hanno riscontrato lo stesso problema, piuttosto handicappante, relativo alla mancata disponibilità del parafango posteriore sul mercato in relazione all'uscita di produzione avvenuta anni fa' e il disinteresse della casa costruttrice (ndr Yamaha) a procedere con un'ulteriore produzione limitata per soddisfare questa esigenza.

Personalmente ritengo importante risolvere definitivamente questo problema, in quanto la mancata disponibilità di un parafango posteriore, componente che spesso si rompe o si deteriora in relazione all'utilizzo specifico di questa moto, non solo costituisce per qualsiasi motociclista da rally o da enduro una forte limitazione all'utilizzo del moto, ma, soprattutto per una moto d'epoca che per essere iscritta all'albo delle moto d'epoca e che deve montare solo parti originali, diventa un problema molto evidente.

Tutti voi, possessori di una Yamaha 600TTR, ora avete finalmente l'opportunità di ottenere questo tanto ambito componente e di poterne aggiungere qualche d'uno in piu', se desiderate, come scorta per il futuro.

Come tutti voi avete già avuto informazioni settimane fa attraverso il gruppo Facebook "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", abbiamo già selezionato il produttore Italiano  https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/  e siamo pronti per partire.

Ci vorranno circa 60 giorni lavorativi, dopo che questa campagna di raccolta fondi sarà completata, per ottenere il prodotto finito pronto per la spedizione.

Per poter avviare la produzione abbiamo individuato l'importo minimo da raggiungere pari a 45.000 euro che corrisponde a circa 530 parafanghi per un costo di circa 85 euro cadauno.

In sintesi, i 45.000 euro saranno destinati per circa 25.000 euro alla produzione dello stampo, circa 15.000 euro a produzione, confezionamento e logistica e circa 5.000 euro a spese di raccolta fondi tramite questa piattaforma.

Se non raggiungiamo l'importo obiettivo, avremo due scelte, o, verranno restituiti integralmente tutti i pagamenti direttamente da Indiegogo (la prima piattaforma al mondo di crowdfunding), oppure, come alternativa, a fronte dell'adesione a questa possibilita' da parte degli iscritti che avranno già formalizzato i loro pagamenti, l'importo residuo per raggiungere l'importo obiettivo verrà essere ripartito sul quantitativo di parafanghi già sottoscritto, in modo tale da consentire l'inizio della produzione.

Provengo personalmente dalla direzione di gruppi di aziende operanti anche nel settore della produzione di componentistica plastica e similare finalizzata alla prima installazione nel settore auto, di conseguenza sono pronto ad affrontare qualsiasi problematica del percorso, ma, ho bisogno dell'aiuto di tutti voi per potervi aiutare a risolvere questo problema, ormai pluriennale, di mancanza di questo componente.

Come gia' anticipato nei mesi scorsi nel gruppo FB la produzione il parafango avverra' in POLIPROPILENE COPOLIMERO resistente a gelo ed UV con apposizione di un tessuto con fibra di vetro della dimensione di 200x150mm sotto la fiancatina destra alfine d'evitare scottature della plastica tramite la marmitta.

FRENCH language:

Je suis administrateur d'un groupe Facebook ( www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) créé en février de cette année pour rassembler tous les propriétaires de Yamaha 600 TTR dans le monde qui ont rencontré le même problème, plutôt handicapant, concernant au manque de disponibilité du garde-boue arrière sur le marché par rapport à la sortie de la production, il y a des années et au manque d'intérêt du constructeur (ed Yamaha) de procéder à une nouvelle production limitée pour répondre à ce besoin.

Personnellement, je trouve important de régler définitivement ce problème, car le manque de disponibilité d'un garde-boue arrière, un composant qui casse ou se détériore souvent par rapport à l'utilisation, constitue non seulement pour tout motocycliste de rallye ou d'enduro une forte limitation à l'utilisation du moto, mais, surtout pour une moto d'époque qui pour être inscrite au registre des motos d'époque ne doit monter que des pièces d'origine, devient un problème très évident.

Vous tous, propriétaires d'une Yamaha 600TTR, avez enfin la possibilité de vous procurer ce composant tant convoité et de pouvoir en ajouter encore plus, comme pièce de rechange pour l'avenir.

Comme vous avez tous déjà eu des informations il y a des semaines via le groupe Facebook "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", nous avons déjà sélectionné le constructeur italien https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ et nous sommes prêts à va.

Il faudra environ 60 jours ouvrables, une fois cette campagne de financement terminée, pour que le produit fini soit prêt à être expédié.

Afin de pouvoir démarrer la production, nous avons identifié le montant minimum à atteindre égal à 45 000 euros ce qui correspond à environ 530 garde-boue pour un coût d'environ 85 euros chacun.

Bref, les 45 000 euros seront alloués soit environ 25 000 euros à la production de moules, environ 15 000 euros à la production, au conditionnement et à la logistique et environ 5 000 euros aux frais de levée de fonds.

Si nous n'atteignons pas le montant cible, nous aurons deux choix, soit, soit tous les versements seront restitués, soit, contre adhésion des souscripteurs qui auront déjà formalisé leurs versements, le montant résiduel pour atteindre le montant, il faudra se partager sur la quantité d'ailes arrière déjà souscrites, pour permettre le démarrage de la production.

Je viens personnellement de la direction de groupes d'entreprises opérant également dans le secteur des composants plastiques et similaires pour la première installation du secteur automobile, par conséquent je suis prêt à faire face à tous les problèmes du chemin, mais, j'ai besoin de vous tous pour laisser Je vous aide tous dans ce problème, maintenant pluriannuel, de manque de ce composant.

Comme déjà anticipé ces derniers mois dans le groupe FB la production du garde-boue se déroulera en POLYPROPYLENE COPOLYMERE résistant au gel et aux UV avec l'apposition d'un tissu en fibre de verre de la taille de 200x150mm sous le côté droit afin d'éviter les brûlures de le plastique à travers le silencieux.

SPANISH language:

Soy el administrador de un grupo de Facebook (www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) creado en febrero de este año para recopilar a todos los propietarios de Yamaha 600 TTR en el mundo que se han encontrado con el mismo problema, bastante perjudicial, de relación a la falta de disponibilidad del guardabarros trasero en el mercado en relación a la salida de producción, hace años ya la falta de interés del fabricante (ed Yamaha) por proceder con una producción más limitada para cubrir esta necesidad.

Personalmente me parece importante solucionar definitivamente este problema, ya que la falta de disponibilidad de un guardabarros trasero, un componente que a menudo se rompe o se deteriora con el uso, no solo constituye para cualquier motociclista de rallies o enduro una fuerte limitación al uso del bicicleta, pero, sobre todo para una moto de época que para ser inscrita en el registro de motos de época sólo deben montar piezas originales, se convierte en un problema muy evidente.

Todos ustedes, propietarios de una Yamaha 600TTR, ahora finalmente tienen la oportunidad de hacerse con este codiciado componente y de poder poner aún más, como repuesto para el futuro.

Como todos ustedes ya tenían información hace semanas a través del grupo de Facebook "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", ya hemos seleccionado al fabricante italiano https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ y estamos listos para ir.

Tomará aproximadamente 60 días hábiles, después de que se complete esta campaña de recaudación de fondos, para que el producto terminado esté listo para su envío.

Para poder iniciar la producción hemos identificado la cantidad mínima a alcanzar igual a 45.000 euros que corresponde aproximadamente a 530 guardabarros por un coste aproximado de 85 euros cada uno.

En definitiva, los 45.000 euros se destinarán por unos 25.000 euros a la producción de moldes, unos 15.000 euros a la producción, envasado y logística y unos 5.000 euros a los costes de captación de fondos.

Si no alcanzamos el monto objetivo, tendremos dos opciones, o bien, o se devolverán todos los pagos, o, en contra de la adhesión de los suscriptores que ya habrán formalizado sus pagos, el monto residual para alcanzar el monto objetivo se compartirá sobre la cantidad de guardabarros traseros ya suscritos, para permitir el inicio de la producción.

Vengo personalmente de la gestión de grupos de empresas que también operan en el sector del plástico y componentes similares para la primera instalación del sector del automóvil, en consecuencia estoy listo para enfrentar cualquier problema del camino, pero, necesito que todos ustedes se dejen Los ayudo a todos en este problema, ahora de varios años, de falta de este componente.

Como ya se anticipó en los últimos meses en el grupo FB la producción del guardabarros se realizará en POLIPROPILENO COPOLÍMERO resistente a las heladas y a los rayos UV con la fijación de un tejido con fibra de vidrio del tamaño de 200x150mm debajo del lado derecho para evitar quemaduras de el plástico a través del silenciador.

GERMAN language:

Ich bin der Administrator einer Facebook-Gruppe (www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/), die diesen Februar gegründet wurde, um alle Yamaha 600 TTR-Besitzer weltweit zu versammeln, die auf das gleiche ziemlich wichtige Problem in Bezug auf die mangelnde Verfügbarkeit auf dem Markt gestoßen sind des hinteren Kotflügels aufgrund der vor Jahren erfolgten Produktionseinstellung und aufgrund des mangelnden Interesses des Herstellers (Hrsg. Yamaha), weitere, wenn auch begrenzte, Produktionen durchzuführen, um diesen Bedarf zu decken.

Ich persönlich halte es für wichtig, dieses Problem endgültig zu lösen, da die fehlende Verfügbarkeit eines hinteren Kotflügels, einer Komponente, die im Rahmen der Nutzung oft bricht oder sich verschlechtert, nicht nur für jeden Rallye- oder Enduro-Motorradfahrer eine ernsthafte Einschränkung darstellt, sondern vor allem , bei einem Oldtimer-Motorrad, das zur Eintragung in das Oldtimer-Motorradregister nur Originalteile montieren darf, wird zu einem ganz offensichtlichen Problem.

Sie alle, Besitzer einer Yamaha 600TTR, haben endlich die Möglichkeit, sich dieses begehrte Bauteil zu besorgen und noch ein paar weitere als Reserve für die Zukunft bauen zu können.

Wie Sie alle vor Wochen in der Facebook-Gruppe "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda" informiert wurden, haben wir den italienischen Hersteller https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ bereits ausgewählt und können loslegen.

Am Ende dieser Spendenaktion dauert es ungefähr 60 Werktage, bis das fertige Produkt versandfertig ist.

Für den Serienstart haben wir einen Mindestbetrag von 45.000 Euro ermittelt, was rund 530 Kotflügeln bei einem Preis von jeweils rund 85 Euro entspricht.

Zusammengefasst werden von den ca. 45.000 Euro ca. 25.000 Euro für den Bau des Werkzeugs, ca. 15.000 Euro für Produktion, Verpackung und Logistik sowie ca. 5.000 Euro für Spendenaufwendungen bereitgestellt.

Sollten wir den Zielbetrag nicht erreichen, haben wir zwei Möglichkeiten: Entweder erstatten wir alle Zahlungen zurück oder, mit Zustimmung von Abonnenten, die ihre Zahlungen bereits formalisiert haben, wird der Restbetrag bis zum Erreichen des Zielbetrags durch die Anzahl der Schutzbleche geteilt bereits bestätigt, so dass der Produktionsstart möglich ist.

Ich persönlich komme aus der Geschäftsführung von Konzernen, die auch im Bereich Kunststoffe und ähnliche Komponenten für die Erstmontage des Automobilbereichs tätig sind, also bin ich bereit, mich auf dem Weg zu allen Problemen zu stellen, aber ich brauche Sie alle, um in der Lage zu sein , wiederum, um Ihnen bei diesem dauerhaften Problem des Fehlens dieser Komponente zu helfen.

Wie bereits in den letzten Monaten in der FB-Gruppe geplant, erfolgt die Fertigung des Kotflügels aus frost- und UV-beständigem POLYPROPYLEN-COPOLYMER mit einem Glasfasergewebe der Dimension 200x150mm unter der rechten Seite, um ein Durchbrennen des Kunststoffs durch den Schalldämpfer zu vermeiden. 

RUSSIAN language:

Я являюсь администратором группы в Facebook (www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/), созданной в феврале этого года, чтобы собрать всех владельцев Yamaha 600 TTR в мире, которые столкнулись с той же проблемой, скорее затруднительной, касающейся из-за отсутствия на рынке задних крыльев в связи с прекращением производства несколько лет назад и отсутствием интереса производителя (ред. Yamaha) к дальнейшему ограниченному производству для удовлетворения этой потребности.

Я лично считаю важным решить эту проблему окончательно, так как отсутствие заднего брызговика, компонента, который часто ломается или портится в связи с использованием, не только составляет для любого мотоциклиста ралли или эндуро сильное ограничение на использование крыла. велосипед, но, особенно для старинного мотоцикла, который для того, чтобы быть зарегистрированным в реестре старинных мотоциклов, должен иметь только оригинальные детали, становится очень очевидной проблемой.

Все вы, владельцы Yamaha 600TTR, теперь, наконец, имеете возможность получить этот столь желанный компонент и иметь возможность добавить еще несколько в качестве запасного на будущее.

Поскольку все вы уже получили информацию несколько недель назад через группу Facebook «TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda», мы уже выбрали итальянского производителя https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ и готовы к идти.

После завершения кампании по сбору средств подготовка готового продукта к отправке займет около 60 рабочих дней.

Чтобы начать производство, мы определили минимальную сумму, которую необходимо достичь, равную 45 000 евро, что соответствует примерно 530 брызговикам по цене примерно 85 евро каждый.

Короче говоря, 45 000 евро будут выделены примерно на 25 000 евро на производство пресс-форм, около 15 000 евро на производство, упаковку и логистику и около 5 000 евро на сбор средств.

Если мы не достигнем целевой суммы, у нас будет два варианта: либо все платежи будут возвращены, либо, против согласия подписчиков, которые уже формализовали свои платежи, остаточная сумма для достижения целевой суммы будет можно разделить на количество уже подписанных задних крыльев, чтобы можно было начать производство.

Я пришел лично из руководства групп компаний, также работающих в секторе пластмасс и аналогичных компонентов для первой установки автомобильного сектора, поэтому я готов столкнуться с любыми проблемами пути, но мне нужно, чтобы все вы позволили Я помогу всем вам в решении этой многолетней проблемы отсутствия этого компонента.

Как уже предполагалось в последние месяцы в группе FB, производство брызговиков будет происходить из ПОЛИПРОПИЛЕНОВОГО СОПОЛИМЕРА, устойчивого к морозу и ультрафиолетовому излучению, с прикреплением ткани со стекловолокном размером 200x150 мм под правой стороной во избежание ожогов. пластик через глушитель.
story_txt:
I am the administrator of a Facebook group ( www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) created in February of this year to collect all the owners of the Yamaha 600 TTR in the world who have encountered the same problem, rather handicapping, relating to the lack of availability of the rear fender on the market in relation to the exit of production, years ago and the lack of interest of the manufacturer (ed Yamaha) to proceed with a further limited production to meet this need.
I personally find it important to fix this problem definitively, as the lack of availability of a rear mudguard, a component that often breaks or deteriorates in relation to use, not only constitutes for any rallie or enduro motorcyclist a strong limitation to the use of the bike, but, especially for a vintage motorbike which in order to be registered in the register of vintage motorcycles must only mount original parts, becomes a very evident problem.
All of you, owners of a Yamaha 600TTR, now finally have the opportunity to get this much coveted component and to be able to put even some more in addition, as a spare for the future.
As all of you already had information weeks ago through the Facebook group "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", we have already selected the Italian manufacturer https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ and we are ready to go.
It will take approximately 60 working days, after this fundraising campaign is completed to get the finished product ready for shipment.
In order to be able to start production we have identified the minimum amount to reach equal to Euro 45,000 which corresponds to approximately 530 mudguards for a cost of approximately Euro 85 each.
In short, the 45,000 euros will be allocated for around 25,000 euros to mold production, around 15,000 euros to production, packaging and logistics and around 5,000 euros to fundraising costs.
If we do not reach the target amount, we will have two choices, either, or all the payments will be returned, or, against adhesion of the subscribers who will have already formalized their payments, the residual amount to reach the target amount it will be shared on the quantity of rear fenders already subscribed, to allow the start of production.
I come personally from the management of groups of companies also operating in the sector of plastic and similar components for the first installation of the car sector, consequently I am ready to face any problems of the path, but, I need all of you to let me help all of you in this, now multi-year problem, of lack of this component.
As already anticipated in recent months in the FB group the production of the mudguard will take place in POLYPROPYLENE COPOLYMER resistant to frost and UV with the affixing of a fabric with glass fiber of the size of 200x150mm under the right side in order to avoid burns of the plastic through the muffler.
ITALIAN language:
Sono l'amministratore di un gruppo Facebook (www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) nato per caso nel febbraio di quest'anno per raccogliere tutti i possessori della Yamaha 600 TTR nel mondo che hanno riscontrato lo stesso problema, piuttosto handicappante, relativo alla mancata disponibilità del parafango posteriore sul mercato in relazione all'uscita di produzione avvenuta anni fa' e il disinteresse della casa costruttrice (ndr Yamaha) a procedere con un'ulteriore produzione limitata per soddisfare questa esigenza.
Personalmente ritengo importante risolvere definitivamente questo problema, in quanto la mancata disponibilità di un parafango posteriore, componente che spesso si rompe o si deteriora in relazione all'utilizzo specifico di questa moto, non solo costituisce per qualsiasi motociclista da rally o da enduro una forte limitazione all'utilizzo del moto, ma, soprattutto per una moto d'epoca che per essere iscritta all'albo delle moto d'epoca e che deve montare solo parti originali, diventa un problema molto evidente.
Tutti voi, possessori di una Yamaha 600TTR, ora avete finalmente l'opportunità di ottenere questo tanto ambito componente e di poterne aggiungere qualche d'uno in piu', se desiderate, come scorta per il futuro.
Come tutti voi avete già avuto informazioni settimane fa attraverso il gruppo Facebook "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", abbiamo già selezionato il produttore Italiano  https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/  e siamo pronti per partire.
Ci vorranno circa 60 giorni lavorativi, dopo che questa campagna di raccolta fondi sarà completata, per ottenere il prodotto finito pronto per la spedizione.
Per poter avviare la produzione abbiamo individuato l'importo minimo da raggiungere pari a 45.000 euro che corrisponde a circa 530 parafanghi per un costo di circa 85 euro cadauno.
In sintesi, i 45.000 euro saranno destinati per circa 25.000 euro alla produzione dello stampo, circa 15.000 euro a produzione, confezionamento e logistica e circa 5.000 euro a spese di raccolta fondi tramite questa piattaforma.
Se non raggiungiamo l'importo obiettivo, avremo due scelte, o, verranno restituiti integralmente tutti i pagamenti direttamente da Indiegogo (la prima piattaforma al mondo di crowdfunding), oppure, come alternativa, a fronte dell'adesione a questa possibilita' da parte degli iscritti che avranno già formalizzato i loro pagamenti, l'importo residuo per raggiungere l'importo obiettivo verrà essere ripartito sul quantitativo di parafanghi già sottoscritto, in modo tale da consentire l'inizio della produzione.
Provengo personalmente dalla direzione di gruppi di aziende operanti anche nel settore della produzione di componentistica plastica e similare finalizzata alla prima installazione nel settore auto, di conseguenza sono pronto ad affrontare qualsiasi problematica del percorso, ma, ho bisogno dell'aiuto di tutti voi per potervi aiutare a risolvere questo problema, ormai pluriennale, di mancanza di questo componente.
Come gia' anticipato nei mesi scorsi nel gruppo FB la produzione il parafango avverra' in POLIPROPILENE COPOLIMERO resistente a gelo ed UV con apposizione di un tessuto con fibra di vetro della dimensione di 200x150mm sotto la fiancatina destra alfine d'evitare scottature della plastica tramite la marmitta.
FRENCH language:
Je suis administrateur d'un groupe Facebook ( www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) créé en février de cette année pour rassembler tous les propriétaires de Yamaha 600 TTR dans le monde qui ont rencontré le même problème, plutôt handicapant, concernant au manque de disponibilité du garde-boue arrière sur le marché par rapport à la sortie de la production, il y a des années et au manque d'intérêt du constructeur (ed Yamaha) de procéder à une nouvelle production limitée pour répondre à ce besoin.
Personnellement, je trouve important de régler définitivement ce problème, car le manque de disponibilité d'un garde-boue arrière, un composant qui casse ou se détériore souvent par rapport à l'utilisation, constitue non seulement pour tout motocycliste de rallye ou d'enduro une forte limitation à l'utilisation du moto, mais, surtout pour une moto d'époque qui pour être inscrite au registre des motos d'époque ne doit monter que des pièces d'origine, devient un problème très évident.
Vous tous, propriétaires d'une Yamaha 600TTR, avez enfin la possibilité de vous procurer ce composant tant convoité et de pouvoir en ajouter encore plus, comme pièce de rechange pour l'avenir.
Comme vous avez tous déjà eu des informations il y a des semaines via le groupe Facebook "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", nous avons déjà sélectionné le constructeur italien https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ et nous sommes prêts à va.
Il faudra environ 60 jours ouvrables, une fois cette campagne de financement terminée, pour que le produit fini soit prêt à être expédié.
Afin de pouvoir démarrer la production, nous avons identifié le montant minimum à atteindre égal à 45 000 euros ce qui correspond à environ 530 garde-boue pour un coût d'environ 85 euros chacun.
Bref, les 45 000 euros seront alloués soit environ 25 000 euros à la production de moules, environ 15 000 euros à la production, au conditionnement et à la logistique et environ 5 000 euros aux frais de levée de fonds.
Si nous n'atteignons pas le montant cible, nous aurons deux choix, soit, soit tous les versements seront restitués, soit, contre adhésion des souscripteurs qui auront déjà formalisé leurs versements, le montant résiduel pour atteindre le montant, il faudra se partager sur la quantité d'ailes arrière déjà souscrites, pour permettre le démarrage de la production.
Je viens personnellement de la direction de groupes d'entreprises opérant également dans le secteur des composants plastiques et similaires pour la première installation du secteur automobile, par conséquent je suis prêt à faire face à tous les problèmes du chemin, mais, j'ai besoin de vous tous pour laisser Je vous aide tous dans ce problème, maintenant pluriannuel, de manque de ce composant.
Comme déjà anticipé ces derniers mois dans le groupe FB la production du garde-boue se déroulera en POLYPROPYLENE COPOLYMERE résistant au gel et aux UV avec l'apposition d'un tissu en fibre de verre de la taille de 200x150mm sous le côté droit afin d'éviter les brûlures de le plastique à travers le silencieux.
SPANISH language:
Soy el administrador de un grupo de Facebook (www.facebook.com/groups/218158413247618/) creado en febrero de este año para recopilar a todos los propietarios de Yamaha 600 TTR en el mundo que se han encontrado con el mismo problema, bastante perjudicial, de relación a la falta de disponibilidad del guardabarros trasero en el mercado en relación a la salida de producción, hace años ya la falta de interés del fabricante (ed Yamaha) por proceder con una producción más limitada para cubrir esta necesidad.
Personalmente me parece importante solucionar definitivamente este problema, ya que la falta de disponibilidad de un guardabarros trasero, un componente que a menudo se rompe o se deteriora con el uso, no solo constituye para cualquier motociclista de rallies o enduro una fuerte limitación al uso del bicicleta, pero, sobre todo para una moto de época que para ser inscrita en el registro de motos de época sólo deben montar piezas originales, se convierte en un problema muy evidente.
Todos ustedes, propietarios de una Yamaha 600TTR, ahora finalmente tienen la oportunidad de hacerse con este codiciado componente y de poder poner aún más, como repuesto para el futuro.
Como todos ustedes ya tenían información hace semanas a través del grupo de Facebook "TTR600 - Acerbis / YAMAHA Belgarda", ya hemos seleccionado al fabricante italiano https://www.cemoto.it/index.php/company/ y estamos listos para ir.
Tomará aproximadamente 60 días hábiles, después de que se complete esta campaña de recaudación de fondos, para que el producto terminado esté listo para su envío.
Para poder iniciar la producción hemos identificado la cantidad mínima a alcanzar igual a 45.000 euros que corresponde aproximadamente a 530 guardabarros por un coste aproximado de 85 euros cada uno.
En definitiva, los 45.000 euros se destinarán por unos 25.000 euros a la producción de moldes, unos 15.000 euros a la producción, envasado y logística y unos 5.000 euros a los costes de captación de fondos.
Si no alcanzamos el monto objetivo, tendremos dos opciones, o bien, o se devolverán todos los pagos, o, en contra de la adhesión de los suscriptores que ya habrán formalizado sus pagos, el monto residual para alcanzar el monto objetivo se compartirá sobre la cantidad de guardabarros traseros ya suscritos, para permitir el inicio de la producción.
Vengo personalmente de la gestión de grupos de empresas que también operan en el sector del plástico y componentes similares para la primera instalación del sector del automóvil, en consecuencia estoy listo para enfrentar cualquier problema del camino, pero, necesito que todos ustedes se dejen Los ayudo a todos en este problema, ahora de varios años, de falta de este componente.
Como ya se anticipó en los últimos meses en el grupo FB la producción del guardabarros se realizará en POLIPROPILENO COPOLÍMERO resistente a las heladas y a los rayos UV con la fijación de un tejido con fibra de vidrio del tamaño de 200x150mm debajo del lado derecho para evitar quemaduras de el plástico a través del silenciador.

Короче говоря, 45 000 евро будут выделены примерно на 25 000 евро на производство пресс-форм, около 15 000 евро на производство, упаковку и логистику и около 5 000 евро на сбор средств.
Если мы не достигнем целевой суммы, у нас будет два варианта: либо все платежи будут возвращены, либо, против согласия подписчиков, которые уже формализовали свои платежи, остаточная сумма для достижения целевой суммы будет можно разделить на количество уже подписанных задних крыльев, чтобы можно было начать производство.
Я пришел лично из руководства групп компаний, также работающих в секторе пластмасс и аналогичных компонентов для первой установки автомобильного сектора, поэтому я готов столкнуться с любыми проблемами пути, но мне нужно, чтобы все вы позволили Я помогу всем вам в решении этой многолетней проблемы отсутствия этого компонента.
Как уже предполагалось в последние месяцы в группе FB, производство брызговиков будет происходить из ПОЛИПРОПИЛЕНОВОГО СОПОЛИМЕРА, устойчивого к морозу и ультрафиолетовому излучению, с прикреплением ткани со стекловолокном размером 200x150 мм под правой стороной во избежание ожогов. пластик через глушитель.

story:
Oasis travel systems   

Hello everyone, my name is Joseph White and I am very excited to bring my idea to life and change transportation for our youth. While we enjoy the heated and cooled seats of our vehicles, our little ones are still in the stone age surrounded by plastics that offer no extended comfort. While my only background in this is being a father myself, I am here to take action and change this issue to better our children.  In the early days of parenthood, I noticed my child was never truly comfortable in her car seat or stroller. No matter what I set the Air condition to she seemed to always have a sweaty back. While also seeing that in cold weather the only answer was to bundle her up so much that she looked like a pink marshmallow with an adorable smile. So I began to think of ways to change this and help her and all other children to be as comfortable as they would want to be, thus Oasis Travel System began. I believe the impact this will have goes far beyond mere additional comfort but increased safety while traveling and more pleasurable outings. Cooling during hot weather will reduce the risk of heat ailments and heating during cold weather will reduce the risk of colds from cold weather. Without the addition of extra layers while traveling in cold weather children will be fastened into their seats properly without the possibility of slipping out in the event of a collision. Furthermore an uncomfortable child is a cranky child and a cranky child is a stressed parent... With your help I know we can change the world of transportation for our little ones, making them and us a lot happier and able to enjoy our moments together more.

 

Funding and Perks

Currently we are Patent pending and moving forward toward a prototype.  I have funded this solely myself up to this point and need your help to reach the finish line.  All funds will go toward product research, development, prototype development, patent fees, attorney fees, advertisement, and production. While perks are still being thought up, I feel  custom patterns and personalized covers will be exactly the sort of perk offered. I would really like feed back on what type of perks really interest the group so as to make everyone happy.

 

Global Impact

While I know there are contributors in the group that aren't parents, I know this is an area everyone can rally around. The impact this will have for children goes beyond words. The addition of safety and comfort this will give children will change this sector forever. Children are more susceptible to heat and cold extremes, affecting their health and wellbeing. Without the ability to properly regulate their own body temperatures they can fall prey to heat sickness and hypothermia. By offering a heating and cooled seat and stroller, the risks are cut down and their comfort increased. 

 

Other Ways to Help

While funding is much appreciate to reach this goal, it isnt the only way people can help. Merely getting the word out to peers and contacts will increase the product visibility and aid in possible larger company assistance with production.

story:
Summary

Hello everyone,

This project will be done by a group of Engineering students at Florida International University. The team hope to raise a total of $10,000 that would go towards the Driver Aid Detection System design and development. All the funds received will go towards our project development, marketing, and manufacturing. This is a system that will save lives and money so join us on our journey

The Impact

Trailer accidents have contributed to a lot of fatalities over the years and our system will help to reduces these numbers. Our project will eliminate the blind spot that exist in trailers making safer for drivers. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk that we will encounter is the accuracy of the data. We have to ensure that the data collected is accurate and delivered to the driver in a timely manner so that he/she can make the necessary adjustments.

story:
--------------------------------------------

MODULAR-LIGHTING-STORAGE 

Modular Size


Modular Shape


Cutting Edge LED Technology

Ultra slim, AC driven, converterless LEDs allow the design to remain elegant and sleek. LEDs sourced from South Korea, the leader in LED technology.

Rewards


Project Status

The Cargo Light is currently on its 4th revision.  A successful campaign will allow me to create the final manufacturing version of the Cargo Light which you will receive by supporting this project.
  • LED upgrade from 4.5 Watts to 12 Watts with dimming ability
  • New connections and cleaner cable routing

Development and Production

The development of the Cargo Light was completed by Nathan Kossak of Ideas Squared LLC.  Located in Phoenix, Arizona, Ideas Squared LLC is a prototyping and micro manufacturing company.  Ideas Squared has recently moved into a new space dedicated to manufacturing the Cargo Light.
For more information about Ideas Squared LLC and Nathan Kossak, check out:
www.ideas-squared.biz
https://instagram.com/ideassquared/

Prototyping Videos


Timeline

  1. Campaign reaches goal (November 2015)
  2. Begin prototyping of final version (Oct-November 2015)(Post Video)
  3. Early Bird Manufacturing begins (November 2015)
  4. Early Bird Ships (January 2016)
  5. Final manufacturing system in place (January 2016)
  6. Final orders ship (May 2016)
  7. Launch E-Commerce (May 2016)

FAQ

story:
Forging a new path in Bike Design and Manufacturing

We’ve re-thought bicycle manufacturing from the ground up. The result is a patented Aerospace design that is completely unique and enables our bike to be manufactured in our hometown. The Celaris adds a new chapter to Windsor’s long history as a hotbed of Canadian manufacturing.


Striking good looks and a smooth, quiet ride.

Our choice of primary drive ratio, patented rider seating position, and the bike’s light weight, give the rider a very low and stable centre of gravity. This makes the bike all but disappear and you will glide along like never before. Riding is believing.

The Celaris puts the rider in a safe riding position. Riding upright helps you to see better. This enhances your ability to look around and behind you. This is another aspect of our revolutionary design.

Be seen and be safe.

The highly reflective mirror finish has eye-catching style, allows easy maintenance, and has great visibility. You will let drivers know where you are by day and especially at night. Reflect the bustle of life.

 
 

 

The Celaris has an innovative frame that's hand-folded from aluminum and formed stainless steel sheet metal. We've taken our cues from the automotive racing and aerospace industries where weight, strength, and durability matter. 

 

SGC has made a dedicated choice to use todays rapid prototype and production technologies creating a bicycle that benefits everyone. We feel there's a lot at stake. The Celaris represents a vision for the evolution of local design and manufacturing with a small and integrated foot print. Our mission is bigger than mere rustbelt revival or the making of a craft bicycle.

 

We are free to look at making bicycles with fresh eyes. 

We use new and cleaner technologies. The Celaris design leaves behind the tube structures that have played the principal role in bike manufacturing for over 100 years. We don’t think of the Celaris as a bike frame at all.

 

Its a unibody if you like.

A unibody that is built locally and easily. The Celaris bicycle is CAD designed/tested and laser cut from a simple and widely available pre finished material - sheet metal. This helps us do things easily and scale our manufacturing processes to demand. We can guide how our bikes should evolve.

The Celaris is meant to be a bicycle first.  

It's just that - a great mode of transportation with elegant good looks. Everything we do as a company comes from the basic premise of wanting to offer you something efficient and beautiful.


As our two years of testing came to a conclusion....

Celaris designer Robert Coyle undertook to do a special edition of 150 frames himself. Half of the Series 1 frames that Robert has made are already on the road and in people’s hands. The other half are offered up to all of you who are out there in the rest of the world.

This is your chance to help us spread the word beyond our region.

We have 70 Series 1 frames personally built by Robert Coyle that have been earmarked for this campaign and your international support. We will ship immediately all Series 1 Celaris bicycles at campaign closure. We're Stocked up. Instantly become part of our growing family.

 

Pre-order a series 2 frame. We have 300 preorders available for our Series 2 frames in this campaign. We have all the components ready and we will begin shipment of our Series 2 preorders two months after campaign close.

Series 2 will incorporate advancements in our production and manufacturing that will make the CELARIS more economical for us to build and therefore more accessible to a larger market.

Getting the word out locally has gained us the enthusiasm and support from bicycle retailers in our region. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Q: How easy is the Celaris to assemble by myself?

A:  We have re-thought how the Celaris is made and packaged it with you in mind. 

      The bike ships with all the tools necessary for assembly. If you read the assembly 

      instructions or watch our video prior to starting, and you are comfortable with threading 

      and tightening bolts; then you can do it! There are no adjustments to Brakes or Gearing 

      required. You might want the help of a friend to hold the frame while you attach the front 

      fork assembly.

Q: How much does the Celaris weigh?

A: Our current unibody weight is 3.75 lbs and that's for a stainless steel bike! Total bike weight

      is between 24 and 28 lbs depending on components and packages.

Q: How do I take care of the finish on my Celaris?

A: We have included a micro fiber cloth to keep your Celaris polished. This is best done 

      with the cloth dry or very lightly moistened. We do not recommend any cleaning agents

      other than soap. When removing excess dirt lightly flush the grit away with water and a 

      sponge prior to drying and polishing with the micro fiber cloth. We never recommend 

      soaping, washing or hosing a bicycle down as if it were a car.

Q: Can I buy accessories for my Celaris?

A: SGC is in development of accessories specific to the Celaris. You may accessorize the bike 

      with any accessory of your choice. However, in order for your warranty to remain valid,

     please contact us if you intend to drill holes in your unibody frame. This is not recommended.

Q: What if I am very tall or short.?

A: The Celaris has been designed to accommodate riders between 4' 11" and 6' 2". 

     It's unfortunate, but for riders outside those dimensions we would recommend that you

     contact a bespoke bicycle builder and have a frame custom made to your dimensions.

Q: Why Call it Celaris? And what would it be in the plural?

A: Designer Robert Coyle has created his own neologism for the bike. He would tell you

that one of his favourite films is the Russian film "Solaris" based on the science fiction novel

by Stanislaw Lem and that he has attached the word Cel due to the celluar nature of the Celaris

designs internal structure.  He might even bring up that word cel has a latin meaning that

points toward the word hidden. We have to allow Robert his abstractions because his Celaris is

a fantastic bike!  As for its plural ?  Robert has supplied us with that too: Celaris'.

 

 

LIMITED LIFETIME WARRANTY 

With due care and correct use, SGC covers your bicycle against defects in materials and their workmanship. Nonetheless, this limited lifetime warranty should not be taken to suggest or imply that your bicycle cannot be broken or that it will last forever. 

This warranty is expressly limited to the repair or replacement of a defective frame, and said repair or replacement is at the sole discretion of SGC Bicycle Manufacturing Inc. No other remedy is available under this warranty. 

Damage resulting from normal wear and tear, including the results of fatigue, is not covered. This warranty is made VOID in its entirety by modication of the frame, fork, or components. 

This bicycle is not intended for trick riding, ramp riding, jumping, aerobatics, aggressive riding, riding on severe terrain, riding in severe climates, racing, riding with heavy loads, riding with more than one person, riding with pets or companion animals, institutional or industrial use, use with a motor, rental, or any similar activities. Such use may damage the bicycle, can cause serious injury, and in all cases shall VOID this warranty. 

SGC Bicycle Manufacturing Inc. declines all responsibility for damages to people, animals or objects due to the use or misuse of this product. 

SGC bicycles are sold exclusively through our web portal and our network of trusted, professional and therefore authorized dealers. By purchasing through us or an authorized dealer, you are assured of authentic SGC quality. To find your preferred dealer, please visit our dealer locator. SGC products purchased through any channel other than an authorized retailer are not covered by this SGC warranty. Any claim led under this warranty must be made through an authorized dealer. This warranty applies only to the original owner of a SGC bicycle and is not transferable to subsequent owners. This warranty applies to all models from the 2016 collection onwards and covers SGC branded products only. Any other original part or component shall be covered by the stated warranty of the original manufacturer. 

THIS WARRANTY DOES NOT COVER: 

• Normal wear and tear including the results of fatigue, a symptom of the frame being worn out through normal use. The preceding example is one kind of normal wear and tear, and it is the owner’s responsibility to inspect his/her bicycle. • Assembly by non- authorized personnel.
• Improper follow-up maintenance. 

• Installation of components, ports, or accessories not originally intended for or compatible with the frame set or bicycle as sold.
• Damage or failure due to accident, misuse, abuse or neglect (including jumping, trick riding, racing or any other non-standard use). • Labour charges for part replacement or changeover.
• Postage and packing costs. But, shipping for a replacement frame will be paid by SGC Manufacturing. 

 

 

 

Here's a little bonus for making it to the end!
An easter egg for all you geeks out there.

Listen to Robert Coyle as he explains SGC bikes foundation and the Celaris design when he appeared on Windsor's AVP Podcast.

story:
A Better Way to Travel

"It's just a one-hour flight."

Four hours later -- after getting up at 4 in the morning, struggling through traffic to the distant airport, winding through endless lines, being poked and prodded by security, sitting wedged in a 17-inch middle seat between two 20-inch fellow travelers -- you're standing curbside , waiting for your ride the last half hour downtown, feeling like you've already put in most of a day's work before even beginning.

There's a better way.

Dreamstar Lines is developing a premium overnight passenger rail service between selected major city pairs. We focus on the sweet spot for our service -- the "500-mile gap" that's too far to drive, too near to fly, but exactly one good night's sleep apart in a rolling hotel.

This isn't your grandparents' sleeping car -- but they'd wish it was.

Your contribution will help us obtain the critical access agreements to track and terminals that will enable us to be up and rolling by 2019.  In return, we'd love to invite you to ride our first route -- Los Angeles to San Francisco -- at an exclusive early-bird price.

What We Need & What You Get

Trains need to run on tracks. We don't own any, so we need access to tracks owned by others. We are in negotiations with the owners of tracks and terminals for access agreements.

Identifying how we can run without interfering with existing train movements takes expert analysis, which costs money.  We need roughly $80,000 in funding to enable us to achieve this critical milestone. 

Once achieved, that opens the way for the additional investments we need to begin service. We're working with our manufacturers to finalize the design of our luxury double-deck sleeping cars and our vendors to provide first class service, and with federal agencies in connection with low-cost public and/or guaranteed financing for our rolling stock.

Your contribution will have a double effect. Beyond the funds alone, your contributions will demonstrate the demand for this service.  We've done market research and found an overwhelmingly positive response -- but nothing beats a pre-order.  We don't just want funders -- we want customers.  If we can point to a few thousand riders willing to put their money where their enthusiasm is, that's great momentum.

So in return for your contribution, you'll receive an overnight ride on the first Dreamstar route -- "Dreamstar Somnium" -- from Los Angeles Union Station to downtown San Francisco.  Depending on what you contribute, you'll enjoy a private roomette, executive bedroom, queen stateroom, first-class suite, or even the top-of-the-line Tycoon Suite.

Plus a hat.  Everybody needs another hat.

We are targeting a launch date of July 2019.

Personal Invitation:

Four years ago, I had a series of morning meetings in the San Francisco Bay area. I quickly found out there's no easy way to get there for those. Yes, it's a one-and-a-half hour flight -- but that time in the air (climbing to 30,000 feet and then almost immediately heading right back down again) is bookended by hours of ground time, none of it pleasant.

I wondered if there was a better way.

I looked at Amtrak -- but while they do run overnight routes, there's none along the California coast (the existing service is a 14-hour daytime run to the East Bay, which takes too long). When I asked them why, they explained that Amtrak (though it makes valiant efforts to maintain a national rail network) simply doesn't have the resources to expand any additional long-distance services, particularly in the face of determined political opposition against subsidized rail.

Now, it's all well and good to "dream of things that never were, and ask why not?" But the "why not?" can't be a rhetorical question. There's often a very good reason why not.

But here -- after extensive, diligent, skeptical effort to find out why a service like ours doesn't already exist -- we can conclude that there is no good reason why it shouldn't.  The demand for the service evidently exists, and the costs can be kept manageable.  (We've been pleasantly surprised more than once to find our cost estimates were too high.)

We started this project because, quite simply, we wanted to use it. We want you to contribute because we think you'll love it, too.

Somewhere between six and twenty percent of the public has an aversion to flying. I'm not one of them (particularly if I can get a window seat -- I'm still pretty much a kid that way). But a "short hop" flight involves a lot more driving and standing around and being manhandled than flying. All of us deserve another option.

So does the earth. Unlike a short-hop flight, we don't have to burn tons of fuel blasting up to 30,000 feet, only to start almost immediately back down again.  Our service is less fuel- and carbon-intensive than either airline travel or private car.

Risks and Challenges:

Essentially, there are three main challenges we face:

1. Track access. We think we'll be able to secure access to our entire route on reasonable terms. But if not -- if the host railroads demand more capacity improvements than we can finance, or access charges than our business model can bear -- we'll need to back off and focus on a different route.

2. Rolling stock financing.  Programs are available to fund or lease railroad equipment on very economical terms. If, however, we aren't approved, we would have to pursue another approach than launching our service with custom-built new equipment, such as leasing existing rolling stock. That would possibly make our initial service less attractive, and would probably delay our opening.

3. Adoption. The ultimate risk is simply this: Will enough people ride with us? We think so. But if not -- or, more immediately, if we can't convince enough major investors that enough of you will ride with us for us to obtain working capital to operate the service until it achieves profitability -- then obviously we can't continue to run.

Again, with regard to that last challenge (as well as the others), your contribution, not just of your funds, but simply your signaling you'd be an enthusiastic customer, will go a long way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can only contribute a small amount (here, have a Dreamstar hat!), just standing up to be counted among our customer base is huge.

Spread the word.  Like and follow us on social media.  (See https://www.facebook.com/dreamstarlines/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel). Share our links.  Don't forget the Indiegogo share tools!

And if you've got some ideas for what a deluxe overnight train simply can't be without -- don't be shy. Let us know at dreamstarlines.com. 

Finally, this: If you're not on the West Coast, don't worry. If there's a "sweet spot" near you -- two major travel markets a good night's sleep apart -- we've probably already analyzed it for a future route.  Keep your eye on us.
story_txt:
A Better Way to Travel
"It's just a one-hour flight."Four hours later -- after getting up at 4 in the morning, struggling through traffic to the distant airport, winding through endless lines, being poked and prodded by security, sitting wedged in a 17-inch middle seat between two 20-inch fellow travelers -- you're standing curbside , waiting for your ride the last half hour downtown, feeling like you've already put in most of a day's work before even beginning.
There's a better way.
Dreamstar Lines is developing a premium overnight passenger rail service between selected major city pairs. We focus on the sweet spot for our service -- the "500-mile gap" that's too far to drive, too near to fly, but exactly one good night's sleep apart in a rolling hotel.
This isn't your grandparents' sleeping car -- but they'd wish it was.
Your contribution will help us obtain the critical access agreements to track and terminals that will enable us to be up and rolling by 2019.  In return, we'd love to invite you to ride our first route -- Los Angeles to San Francisco -- at an exclusive early-bird price.

What We Need & What You Get
Trains need to run on tracks. We don't own any, so we need access to tracks owned by others. We are in negotiations with the owners of tracks and terminals for access agreements.
Identifying how we can run without interfering with existing train movements takes expert analysis, which costs money.  We need roughly $80,000 in funding to enable us to achieve this critical milestone. 
Once achieved, that opens the way for the additional investments we need to begin service. We're working with our manufacturers to finalize the design of our luxury double-deck sleeping cars and our vendors to provide first class service, and with federal agencies in connection with low-cost public and/or guaranteed financing for our rolling stock.
Your contribution will have a double effect. Beyond the funds alone, your contributions will demonstrate the demand for this service.  We've done market research and found an overwhelmingly positive response -- but nothing beats a pre-order.  We don't just want funders -- we want customers.  If we can point to a few thousand riders willing to put their money where their enthusiasm is, that's great momentum.
So in return for your contribution, you'll receive an overnight ride on the first Dreamstar route -- "Dreamstar Somnium" -- from Los Angeles Union Station to downtown San Francisco.  Depending on what you contribute, you'll enjoy a private roomette, executive bedroom, queen stateroom, first-class suite, or even the top-of-the-line Tycoon Suite.Plus a hat.  Everybody needs another hat.
We are targeting a launch date of July 2019.

Personal Invitation:
Four years ago, I had a series of morning meetings in the San Francisco Bay area. I quickly found out there's no easy way to get there for those. If, however, we aren't approved, we would have to pursue another approach than launching our service with custom-built new equipment, such as leasing existing rolling stock. That would possibly make our initial service less attractive, and would probably delay our opening.
