story:
Intelligent Cranium Helmets LLC (ICH) was started in 2015 with an idea for a helmet which will help save lives and enhance a rider’s experience. Currently motorcycle riders (including a number of ICH team members) have a huge blind spot around them that has left them vulnerable and susceptible to life threatening accidents, however;

ICH has solved this problem by integrating custom and currently available technologies into a motorcycle helmet that alerts and allows the rider to see danger before it’s too late.

Further, our patented technology and design enables the rider to leverage custom and existing mobile technology to take advantage of everything their smartphone has to offer. 

The Problem - Blindspots

 

The Solution

 

iC-R Dual Rear Camera Blind-spot Elimination w/Proximity Sensors

 

TheRideAdvice: “The iC-R (Intelligent Cranium) helmet packs a lot of the same technology that these other products do, but what we like most about it is that it actually seems to make an effort to make these features part of improving rider safety instead of just being there for the sake of it.”

Gizmag/New Atlas: “Intelligent Cranium’s iC-R helmet is the most ambitious high-tech helmet project we’ve seen…”

 

Motorcycle Safety Stats

  • In 2017 there were 5,172 motorcyclists killed in motor vehicle traffic crashes
  • Of the 5,172 motorcyclists killed in traffic crashes, 94 percent (4,885) were riders and 6 percent (287) were passengers
  • In States without universal helmet laws, 57 percent of motorcyclists killed in 2017 were not wearing helmets, as compared to 8 percent in States with universal helmet laws

Source: NHTSA’s National Center for Statistics and Analysis

 

The Safety of the iC-R (HW & SW)

THE PHYSICAL BUILD

Each iC-R model is designed and built with care and the utmost safety in mind.  For the physical build; we're securing each helmet in Carbon Fiber & Kevlar for the ultimate in durability.  Taking safety even further, we're pushing the limits for: DOT, SNELL, and ECE 22.05 certifications prior to shipping.  Oh...there's one other one, but we're saving that as a big surprise once obtained.

Note: The iC-R will initially be produced overseas due to time and cost, but the HW assembly/functional testing/QA of our helmets will be completed here in the U.S.

THE HARDWARE

Almost every motorcycle rider has had at least ONE close encounter while riding, where a vehicle almost (or in some case did) blind side them because neither the rider nor the driver of the vehicle saw each other. 

The core of our helmets hardware is centered around safety.  The iC-R lineup is unmatched in features and  safety, with critical safety features like:

Dual rear-view cameras that ELIMINATE BLINDSPOTS and provide a 240 degree blind spot FOV; while similar products don't provide this key safety element and only produce a maximum of 180 degrees FOV

Dual rear proximity/sonar sensors that provide a visual (via the HUD) and audible (optional & can be disabled) alert of hazards within 5-15ft

Ultra-bright rear LED helmet lights that make you nearly impossible to miss to drivers on the road at night/low light settings

[GPS HELMET TRACKER] - Never lose track of where you helmet is with our "Find My Helmet" feature in our companion app

[AUTO TINTING VISOR] - Designed so riders never have to take their hands off  their bikes; see clearly all the time

[INTERNAL SPEAKERS] - We've really looked at the placement of our internal speakers as much as the sound.  Instead of the uncomfortable feeling of wireless buds or speakers that constantly push up against your ears in an already very snug fitting helmet; we've recessed our speakers a little to take care of that.  Now you can enjoy that immersive sound for longer rides.

[HEADS-UP DISPLAY HARDWARE] - A 1920x1080 resolution and 40 degree FOV waveguide projection module fixed to the interior portion of the helmet, projects the rear-view camera feed onto our HUD as an overlay on the road ahead.  Our HUD is able to be easily removed and stored away if desired. 

 

THE SOFTWARE

[HEADS-UP DISPLAY SOFTWARE] - With our overall software, but specifically dealing with our Heads-up Dispaly (HUD); we've taken a different and what we feel to be a much safer approach.  The iC-R is meant to provide you safety first, and an incredible experience.  What you see in the above GIF is where we started, but our new approach to what you see on our HUD is simply to show you only the information that truly matters.  We're now limiting the information to only the: rear camera FOV, GPS Navigation, unobtrusive proximity alerts, and visual confirmation when you are/aren't recording your ride; which will be shown in a future updates.

 

[EMERGENCY SERVICES ALERT SYSTEM (ESAS)] - In the event of an accident, our ESAS will alert not only emergency contacts but the nearest Emergency Services (First Responders) if the rider is unresponsive within 5-20 seconds.

[VOICE RECOGNITION/COMMAND] - The ability to perform tasks hands-free is a huge safety concern, and a huge undertaking.  So that's what we're doing.  Not only are we working to provide you with hands-free functionality while wearing your iC-R, we're personalizing it too with our own artificial intelligence.

[BLUETOOTH W/RIDER-TO-RIDER COMMUNICATION] - Connecting riders with one or many ride buddies via voice activation; on demand.  Now providing you with a stronger, more stable connection via Bluetooth Mesh Network.

[FRONT ACTION CAMERA] - With a 4k@60FPS camera riders can capture, share, and live stream their ride and anything in their FOV; in HD.  Designed to be embedded and replace the use of other helmet mounted action cameras; making the rider helmet that much lighter and integrated.  Who wants to mess around with mounts and an action camera that's adding a weird amount of weight to one section of your helmet; as well as negatively changing the natural aerodynamics of your helmet as you ride?

[RESPIRATORY FILTER] - Your safety and your health go hand in hand---that's why we've also included a washable respiratory filter to help protect you from dust, allergens, odors, and other invisible & harmful particulates while you're traveling from place to place.

[MODULAR HARDWARE] - The majority of the iC-R's components will be modular, and able to be replaced without the need to replace the entire helmet.  This move makes the iC-R even more unique, useful, affordable, and really sets us apart from our competitors.  With this in our design, we look to create a number of jobs within the U.S.; further reducing the repair/replacement timeline (if needed).

 

Helmet Sizing Chart

 

All iC-R Models Available in Matte Black, Red, or White

 

 

Funding Targets

 

Road to Delivery Timeline 

 

The Team & Who Supports Our Success

To be successful, ICH brought together a select handful of experienced US Department of Defense (DoD) Veterans, Development Engineers, and energetic young talent. The core team has over 50 years of experience in development and acquisition programs, over 40 years in riding experience, and is 100% dedicated to bringing this exciting new product to market.

Since our inception we've had numerous think-tank sessions, revisions, and alterations within our design to ensure that we develop a product that will:

  • Be safe above all
  • Provide comfort that exceeds expectations
  • Give riders access to the most useful and best hands-free technology
  • Be revolutionary, yet affordable and adaptable

 

             Ambrose D. - Chief Executive Officer

 

    Anthony D. - Chief Operations Officer (Ret. Army)

 

   Robert I. - Chief Financial Officer (Ret. Air Force)

 

                Yolanda D. - Executive Assistant

 

          Deborah J.H. - Product Support Manager (Ret. Army)

 

Those Supporting Our Success

[Kreatif Design] - the team responsible for the beautiful helmet design you see today, and that you will soon be able to wear and enjoy

[Shenzhen Manufacturing Partner] - who has been a very helpful resource and who will be manufacturing our helmets; ensuring all safety standards are met and helmets shipped out in a timely manner.  They have successfully passed ISO9001: 2008 quality certification to fully equip production facilities with advanced equipment to ensure product design, R & D, pilot production, and mass-production quality.  They have over 18 years of experience and are primed to help ICH succeed.

[Adekunle Adepoju] - who served as a Systems Engineer resource for our project

[Vlad Tyum] - who supported us with portions of software/embedded computer vision

[Art Schweiss] - who has been an incredible resource for specific hardware needs

[Hallsten Innovations] - who supports our electrical engineering needs, and assisted with main PCB design and debugging

We are proud of what has been accomplished thus far, with the resources available.  We are here ready to see this product through to completion, bring it market and into the hands of all riders.  We need your support to get us there.  With your support financially and through spreading the word, paired with our years of developmental expertise and unwavering commitment; success is inevitable.  Support a company that will forever be here to support you!

 

Risks & Challenges

In any start-up there will be challenges and obstacles to overcome.  Some financial,  operational, and challenges within ones organization; all of which are unforeseen.  The key to succeeding is through perseverance and thinking outside of the box.

Though ICH is not a new company starting our company in 2015, there are many good things about where we are and not being a brand new company; such as:

  • We've already gone through the big hurdles of a new organization in finding the right talent and colleagues to see this product through to the end.
  • We've dealt with development companies who's business to business ethics are not where they should be.
  • We've navigated through to the right developmental partnerships needed to take the iC-R from concept, to production, and into all rider's hands.

ICH has endured most of the challenges that cause start-up company's to give up and close down.  Since our inception, we have minimized any future risks by:

  • Ensuring our core team is solid and has the proper credentials and expertise to get the job done.
  • Critically thought through every part of the design of the iC-R, its features, and affordable pricing so that all can be safe while riding.
  • Aligning ourselves with the proper developmental and manufacturing partnerships to help produce the right product, and on time.

Realistically, no one can predict every possible issue that may arise within a development such as this.  What we have learned through years of experience is to plan and prepare for the worst possible issues; which is what we have done.  With your support and trust in the integrity of Intelligent Cranium Helmets, ALL will enjoy the success of this development and the quality of the product that will come from it.  Our backers have our sincere commitment that we will provide:

  • regular and timely updates
  • complete responsiveness to inquiries
  • our promise and dedication to deliver this product

As a company, we hold strong to our values of essentially just doing good business. Once we meet (prayerfully exceed) our campaign funding goal, we will meet our initial production plans. Prior to launching we ironed everything surrounding production out so that we went into this campaign knowing that we would succeed upon successful funding. If we don't raise enough funds to proceed, then all funds raised will be returned to our backers; without question. We're here for the long haul.  We  sincerely appreciate the support of our current and future fans, and we can't wait to bring forth the first TRULY smart and situational awareness smart helmet.

-The Dream Team at Intelligent Cranium Helmets

If we don't raise enough funds to proceed, then all funds raised will be returned to our backers; without question. We're here for the long haul.  We  sincerely appreciate the support of our current and future fans, and we can't wait to bring forth the first TRULY smart and situational awareness smart helmet.-The Dream Team at Intelligent Cranium Helmets

story:
The Inspiration behind The Chopper by Revolve Electric Bikes

July 1969:

In July 1969, a movie was released called the “Easy Rider” starring Peter Fonda. That movie introduced the world to the motorcycle known as the Chopper. The Chopper motorcycle is distinctive with it’s trademark type handlebars, wheels and extended frame. The Chopper was created and designed in the 1960’s.

August 2018:

Revolve has been a major player in the Electric Bike market since 2010. We are always searching for new designs and upgrading components. August 2018 is when we made a decision to develop The Chopper as an electric bike. We used the unique handlebars- when one sees these handlebars, they immediately say- “it’s a Chopper”. We decided to have two different size tires. One 24” in the rear and a smaller 20” in the front. The tires are 4” wide providing true motorcycle traction. The frame had to be developed to be longer than a traditional bike frame so one can extend their legs. Look how comfortable Peter Fonda looks riding the Chopper. We have designed ours for your riding comfort. Whether your height is 5’2” or 6’7”- one size fits all. Adjust the seat and handlebars and you will look as comfortable as Peter Fonda. Lastly, we added the best quality components to this bike- Bafang motor, Tektro hydraulic brakes and Samsung battery.

Frankly, there is no other electric bike in the market that duplicates this bike in design and quality.  

February 2020:

Revolve is launching on Indiegogo the opportunity for you to have your own Chopper. For those that take advantage of this opportunity during the 30 days this program is running, they will receive significant discount in price and delivery by May 2020.  Please either sign up so we can update you on the launch date on Indiegogo or send an email to RevolveEbikes27@gmail.com.

History of Revolve Electric Bikes:

Revolve began importing electric bikes to both the US and Europe in June 2010. Since that time, we have created over 75 different models, manufactured and sold thousands of bikes. We are based in New York. We have two warehouses (NY and California). This has been our way to satisfy our dealers and consumers anywhere in the US conveniently.

Revolve is a company that was created to sell electric bikes.  All bikes are powered by batteries.  Prior to launching any of our products, management of Revolve devotes extensive time assuring that quality is a priority.  To accomplish this mission, we have visited our suppliers of batteries and bicycles to ascertain that quality is uppermost in their minds-not just ours. Using the best components also is a priority. We have ordered production models from potential manufacturers and subjected the bikes and vehicles to rigorous tests before accepting these manufacturers as suppliers.  Every product comes with a warranty.  Parts such as brakes and wheels which are subjected to normal wear and tear are not covered by warranties.

We do not just create, manufacture and sell bikes. We order and stock spare parts in the warehouses. We carry spare parts for all Revolve EBikes, even for some that are 9 years old. We have a network of dealers we use across the US that will service a Revolve bike, if needed. For the most part, most of the request are for replacement batteries after 3-5 years of use.

We are accessible to you by either email (Revolveebikes27@gmail.com) or by phone (212-897-7771). We respond to emails or phone calls immediately. Essentially- we are there for you.

We are now asking you to back us on Indiegogo because we are not new or strangers to this industry. You are backing a company that has passed the test of time in selling thousands of bikes to satisfied customers.

Product Description:

The Chopper is your way to escape. The 750w Bafang motor allows you to cruise at speeds up to 27mph and conquer any hill in your path. The bike is powered by a 48v 14ah Samsung cell battery. You will comfortably travel ranges from 30-50 miles. Our 22amp controller which is waterproof, allows you to ride in all types of weather. The front and rear lights both operate from the battery. Once you turn on your lights, both lights will be illuminated. The LCD display screen, which is multi-colored, tracks your battery level, speed, pedal assist level and distance traveled. The beige comfortable seat comes with matching comfort hand grips.

What’s Included:

  • Bike
  • Fenders
  • Battery and charger
  • Front and rear lights
  • Delivered requiring minimal assembly
  • User manual

Weight:

Battery: 9 lbs.

Bike plus battery: 68lbs

Maximum carrying weight: 350lbs

Dimensions:

Please refer to chart

Technical Specs:

Battery:

  • Lithium ion 48v 14ah Samsung cells
  • 4-6 hours charge time

Motor:

  • 750W Bafang motor
  • 5 levels of pedal assist
  • Thumb throttle

Brakes:

  • Tektro hydraulic disc brakes

Tires:

  • Kenda front tire is 20” x 4”
  • Kenda rear tire is 24” x 4”
  • 30PSI

Controller:

  • 22amp Waterproof Controller

Gears:

  • Shimano 6 speeds

Frame:

  • Aluminum Alloy

Why should I buy the Chopper?

The Chopper was designed to create a comfortable ride, with a powerful motor, long-lasting battery and a unique look. We also discovered that of the limited quantity we sold, many were purchased by former motorcycle riders and the reviews were great.

To create that comfortable ride, most people like to sit straight up without bending. The Chopper type handlebars do just that, plus the handlebars can be adjustable to exactly your desired position. We added a nice large seat and cushy handgrips.

To make it powerful, we are using a 750 Bafang motor with a 22amp waterproof controller. The combination of a motor with a large controller is essential to make sure the power is captured when needed. This combination will allow you to cruise at 27mph and not allowing any hill to be an obstacle. This is one of the best electric motors in the market and in some circles better than Bosch. The Chopper has both throttle and 5 levels of pedal assist.

Since you will be travelling at a good speed, we want to make sure you can stop. The brakes are hydraulic disc made by Tektron.  

The battery is lithium. It has 48volts/14amp hours. The cells are Samsung.

The unique look is obvious. We are using two different size Kenda fat tires. The front is 20” x 4.0 and the rear is 24” x 4.0. The frame is long so the rider can sit up and stretch out their legs. Since 2010, Revolve Electric Bikes has led by design. There is no other company offering this design or quality.

Since Revolve has been around for just about 10 years, we have a network of dealers throughout the country that can service an electric bike. As electric bikes become more popular, more and more dealers will become available.

Aside from the attributes just mentioned, this bike normally sells at dealers for $2,999.00. If you want delivery by May 2020, we are prepared to sell it, including free shipping for $1,499.00. That is a 50% discount- do not hesitate. Go to Indiegogo and back us as soon as you can.

Financing can be obtained through PayPal Credit or Acima Credit. If you need further info, please contact us at Revolveebikes27@gmail.com or 212-897-7771.

Chopper Review

This is a review of the original Chopper bike BEFORE the upgrades. The new bike being shipped in May 2020 will have a bigger motor as well as other upgrades. The Revolve Chopper is a unique hub-drive fat tire bike with a style reminiscent of chopper style motorcycles with its matte black accents, 12” rising handlebars, and wide saddle with comfort springs.  Read Full Review. 

More Reviews:

"As a former owner of several motorcycles, including a real Chopper motorcycle, I recently purchased the Chopper by Revolve Electric Bikes. It was a 50th  birthday present to myself. Let me summarize this bike in one word “awesome”. Between the comfort, great cruising power and durability, I love this bike. Lastly, Revolve Electric Bikes are great bikes- they do a great job in creating quality e-bikes- I have purchased several for my family."
Chris M
New York

"I love my Revolve EB chopper. Great comfort and the chopper look catches everyone’s eye. Quality product at a competitive price range you can’t go wrong."
Robert R
Virginia

"As a businessman I wanted something to relieve some stress. As a senior citizen I wanted a way to make exercise easy. When I saw an electric bike that reminded me of the cool bikes from my
childhood, I knew I had a winner.  The "Chopper" is easy to ride and has plenty of power. In addition, it is the coolest bike in the neighborhood. Thanks Revolve!"
Greg L
Florida

Compare E-Bikes:

Where to Ship:

US (all 50 states + DC). Shipments to Alaska and Hawaii is an additional $100.00. Worldwide shipping fees outside of the US exclude GST, VAT, equivalent taxes and custom duties. GST and VAT, if any, will be collected from backers at the time of delivery.

When We Start Shipping:

Orders placed now for delivery in the US will begin shipping from our California warehouse in May 2020. Orders to Europe or South America will begin shipping in May 2020 as well.

Why Order Now:

All orders will be honored. We can produce over 2000 bikes per month. We will continue the production to complete any additional orders. Should there be any delays beyond our expected start ship dates in May 2020, we will notify you. Ordering now means you will be the first ones to receive the Chopper. Also, by backing now, you will be among the first to experience the Chopper, an electric bike that provides an unbelievable riding experience.

You also will benefit by receiving a substantial discount in the purchase price.

story:
By searching online, we shock by the reports about bike theft. Almost every 10 seconds a bike is missing somewhere in the world.That’s why we come up with Walsun. I thought there had be a better option.Fingerprint identification saves you from keys, combinations, and lock picking, protecting your bicycle, or motorbike.

The disc brake lock weighs only 220 grams and is locked to the disc brake for bicycles and motorcycles. Unlock with your finger, integrated design works and Anti-theft. Without lock Strap.

Walsun is not only for bicycles,but fits for motorcycles and e-bikes. The 6mm lock pin fits for most motorcycles and bikes with disc brakes which is less than 6mm thick. Stapler style can prevent potential damage caused by riding away while Walsun is engaged.

 

 

In order to reduce any default, there’s one button on the left side of the lock. The lock will automatically enter into the “ sleeping mode”, which means no reaction when you try to unlock it with your finger. Don't worry and the lock still protects your bike, locking your bike.If you want to unlock the lock, you must click the button to wake it up and unlock with your fingerprint. It can prolong the stand-by time of the lock and avoid any copy of our fingerprints.

Walsun Team strive to develop products which meet the needs and taste of the cyclist. With a sense of security and aesthetics, Walsun Team continues to design and produce fashionable and dependable fingerprint lock. We want to provide reliable and use friendly safety guard for your beloved family and partners.

story:
Sophies Angels is a new, female only, personal passenger service which has begun is Wellington New Zealand with our first and only driver, and founder; Sophie Denman.  Our goal is to provide an alternative transport option to female clients who are seeking a safer and more comfortable way to get around. 

Sophie has been a driver in the passenger transport industry for over a year and in that time she realised two things:

1 – There are women who do not feel safe, or comfortable, or respected, when taking taxis or their alternatives.  This problem is made worse for young women who want to socialise and go out at night.

2 – Sophie could not earn a living wage working as she was as a full time driver.  Due fuel costs, taxes, insurance and the cost to maintain her own vehicle, and the companies percentage she was effectively paying the company to drive people from place to place.

 

This is where Sophies Angels began.  To take Sophie’s own personal experiences and those of her passengers and turn it into a revolution in the transport industry.  A company where the customers feel safe, and the drivers can earn fair pay.  A company that understands why women do not feel safe, and acknowledges it.  Where we strive to remove and reduce the dangers and threats, by first admitting that they are there. 

All our vehicles will have live video streaming to our monitoring centre, and this will be recorded so we can investigate complaints, and to deter any misconduct.  Our drivers will all require passenger endorsements and a clean driving record, as well as have the supportive and protective attitude that makes her an Angel.

Our initial goal here is to develop a smart phone App to connect our clients to our drivers, to arrange bookings and to report feedback.  We need a large amount of money to achieve this.  We are asking for NZ$100,000.00 to develop the App and start hiring additional drivers.

If we reach $300,000.00 we will invest in a fleet of vehicles and lease office space for administration and support staff.  We will also plan to approach the New Zealand Police and government as well as local support agencies to provide a free emergency service for women in need.

If we surpass one million dollars in donations we will begin nationwide operations in New Zealand and develop plans to go worldwide.

We are pleading with you for your support. 

 

For more information go to: www.sophiesangels.org or visit our Facebook: www.facebook.com/sophiesangels2016

story:
When I was a teenager I raced Grand Prix karts and as an adult I found myself with this urge to race again  and  was unable to shake it. I have now set out to make such cars. Over the years, I have  met a few other fans of the Grand Prix  karts and it inspired me to form a team of builders with diverse talents. Together, we can build the complete kart from the ground up.




We hope to make Grand Prix style karts available to the general public and maybe one day, with growing popularity, Bring-Your-Own Kart race tracks will pop up around the U.S . We want to be a part of bringing these karts back. Because we already have the skills and most of the tools, we only need two things. With your help, I think we can all make this dream come true.  With enough contributions it is possible.

• The Future...A shifter kart on steroids! What if you could buy a new frame or kart and add any power plant you want?  Placing a 600 cc motor with gear changing options on the kart would make this a very competitive kart to race. 

• The Goal... To build and bring to the market a flexible platform  that fits a couple of open wheel racers. With our platform you can chose between 3 classic race body styles. Original Open Wheel, Next Gen Open Wheel with rear spoiler, and Open Wheel Grand Prix with full front and rear spoiler.  All frames will be compatible with all three bodies. 

 • What we need... We are asking for contributers to help raise money for the tubing bender and  the notcher for the custom frame constructions. We are attempting to raise $1000 to pay for the two tools needed in order to complete the prototype. 

• What we have..  We have a team of talented people and the tools needed to build almost anything.  We have access to a full size body shop for assembly as well as a shop prepped and ready for paint and custom design. 

• Who are we..  We are a small team ranging in age from 29 to 50 years old. Our team includes   ex-military, wood workers, metal  fabricators, mechanics, small power plant techs, welders, and custom painters.  

• What experience do we have... Collectively the team has experience  building classic show cars from the ground up that won awards,  custom  bikes or trailers, repairing and rebuilding  fiberglass.  

The Plan..  

• Phase One: Build a standard frame to fit three generations of open wheel race karts and offer them to the public. Pre-orders are available at this phase.

• Phase Two:  Build plugs and molds for the three body styles of open wheel race karts.  

• Phase Three:  We plan to offer complete rolling RTR  (ready to run) Grand Prix style race karts with your choice of power plants and bodies. 

About the cars

Each car will feature independent front suspensions and rear swing arm suspension, front disc brakes and rear disc brakes, parking brake, and multi-speed standard transmission (gear count determined by motor option).   

 • Frame: one inch tubular steel reinforced roll cage. 

 • Suspension : four wheel independent  with coil over shocks  

 • Steering: rack and pinion.  

 • Brakes: Disc. (Willwood) 

  • Rear End: independent swing arms with cv joint drive shafts, disc brakes and swapable chain drive gear.  

  • Power Plant:  able to accept any chain driven power plant with internal clutch or can be used in conjuction with external clutch after slight modification. 

 • Shifting:  At first, only a standard option will be available. Later we hope to research and develop a paddle shifter into the steering wheel as well as other race inspired technology.   
Rotax Ace 900 Turbo , 4 stroke, 3 cylinder,154 H.P.
Above- one power plant up for consideration.
 

FAQ 

•Will the parts from LOLA cars fits yours?  Answer:  No , they will not be compatible. With our planned set up you will be able to change your final drive gear and with some slight modifications to the motor mount, adapt to nearly any small motor of your choice

      The difference between the LOLA cars and our Grand Prix style karts will be in the cockpit guages, the rear end suspension, the swapable gear ratio and  the power plant options to name a few. 

•Can I choose my own color/design? Answer: Yes, we plan to offer custom paint color and designs. 

•Will you ship world wide? Answer: Not at this time. Though, we hope to make this option available in the future.

•What is the expected max speed? Answer : We are expecting, with planned gearing and from research, to be above 60 mph but for saftey reasons plan to be under 80 mph stock. As with most anything powered, you can increase that number with modification.   

• What customization options do you plan to offer? Answer : We plan to offer  various power plant options, a choice of three body styles and your personal frame color/design, interior color, and wheel  color.  We want to give as many options as we can so each kart can be uniquely you.  

•What if I want to use a snow mobile or rotax engine? Answer:  As we grow we plan to offer adapter plates for adding jack shafts and other motor mounts to retro fit an existing kart or be able to order it when ordering the kart new. 

•Where will these be made? Answer: These will be hand-built in the DFW area of North Texas, U.S.A.  

*Disclaimer: These karts are serious adult karts only meant for licensed drivers age 16 or older.    

Risks and challenges

Some of the challenges we have faced have been to locate the right parts for the scale of the car we are building. It took a few years of research to locate certain parts and the frame images required. At this time, the remaining challenge is a steady supply of power plants of up to four cylinder/four cycle 600cc motors.
story_txt: When I was a teenager I raced Grand Prix karts and as an adult I found myself with this urge to race again  and  was unable to shake it. I have now set out to make such cars. Over the years, I have  met a few other fans of the Grand Prix  karts and it inspired me to form a team of builders with diverse talents. Together, we can build the complete kart from the ground up.We hope to make Grand Prix style karts available to the general public and maybe one day, with growing popularity, Bring-Your-Own Kart race tracks will pop up around the U.S . We want to be a part of bringing these karts back. Because we already have the skills and most of the tools, we only need two things. With your help, I think we can all make this dream come true.  With enough contributions it is possible.• The Future...A shifter kart on steroids! What if you could buy a new frame or kart and add any power plant you want?  Placing a 600 cc motor with gear changing options on the kart would make this a very competitive kart to race. • The Goal... To build and bring to the market a flexible platform  that fits a couple of open wheel racers. With our platform you can chose between 3 classic race body styles. Original Open Wheel, Next Gen Open Wheel with rear spoiler, and Open Wheel Grand Prix with full front and rear spoiler.  All frames will be compatible with all three bodies.  • What we need... We are asking for contributers to help raise money for the tubing bender and  the notcher for the custom frame constructions. We are attempting to raise $1000 to pay for the two tools needed in order to complete the prototype. • What we have..  We have a team of talented people and the tools needed to build almost anything.  We have access to a full size body shop for assembly as well as a shop prepped and ready for paint and custom design. • Who are we..  We are a small team ranging in age from 29 to 50 years old. Our team includes   ex-military, wood workers, metal  fabricators, mechanics, small power plant techs, welders, and custom painters.  • What experience do we have... Collectively the team has experience  building classic show cars from the ground up that won awards,  custom  bikes or trailers, repairing and rebuilding  fiberglass.  The Plan..  • Phase One: Build a standard frame to fit three generations of open wheel race karts and offer them to the public. Pre-orders are available at this phase.• Phase Two:  Build plugs and molds for the three body styles of open wheel race karts.  • Phase Three:  We plan to offer complete rolling RTR  (ready to run) Grand Prix style race karts with your choice of power plants and bodies. About the carsEach car will feature independent front suspensions and rear swing arm suspension, front disc brakes and rear disc brakes, parking brake, and multi-speed standard transmission (gear count determined by motor option).    • Frame: one inch tubular steel reinforced roll cage.  • Suspension : four wheel independent  with coil over shocks   • Steering: rack and pinion.   • Brakes: Disc. (Willwood)   • Rear End: independent swing arms with cv joint drive shafts, disc brakes and swapable chain drive gear.    • Power Plant:  able to accept any chain driven power plant with internal clutch or can be used in conjuction with external clutch after slight modification.  • Shifting:  At first, only a standard option will be available. Later we hope to research and develop a paddle shifter into the steering wheel as well as other race inspired technology.   Rotax Ace 900 Turbo , 4 stroke, 3 cylinder,154 H.P.Above- one power plant up for consideration. FAQ •Will the parts from LOLA cars fits yours?  Answer:  No , they will not be compatible. With our planned set up you will be able to change your final drive gear and with some slight modifications to the motor mount, adapt to nearly any small motor of your choice      The difference between the LOLA cars and our Grand Prix style karts will be in the cockpit guages, the rear end suspension, the swapable gear ratio and  the power plant options to name a few. •Can I choose my own color/design? Answer: Yes, we plan to offer custom paint color and designs. •Will you ship world wide? Answer: Not at this time. Though, we hope to make this option available in the future.•What is the expected max speed? Answer : We are expecting, with planned gearing and from research, to be above 60 mph but for saftey reasons plan to be under 80 mph stock. As with most anything powered, you can increase that number with modification.   • What customization options do you plan to offer? Answer : We plan to offer  various power plant options, a choice of three body styles and your personal frame color/design, interior color, and wheel  color.  We want to give as many options as we can so each kart can be uniquely you.  •What if I want to use a snow mobile or rotax engine? Answer:  As we grow we plan to offer adapter plates for adding jack shafts and other motor mounts to retro fit an existing kart or be able to order it when ordering the kart new. •Where will these be made? Answer: These will be hand-built in the DFW area of North Texas, U.S.A.  *Disclaimer: These karts are serious adult karts only meant for licensed drivers age 16 or older.    Risks and challengesSome of the challenges we have faced have been to locate the right parts for the scale of the car we are building. It took a few years of research to locate certain parts and the frame images required. At this time, the remaining challenge is a steady supply of power plants of up to four cylinder/four cycle 600cc motors.
